{{Infobox military person | name = George Augustus Schomberg | image = | caption = | nickname = | birth_date = 5 October 1821 | birth_place = | death_date =5 December 1907 | death_place = | allegiance = {{flag|United Kingdom}} | branch = [[File:RoyalMarineBadge.svg|23px]] [[Royal Marines]] | serviceyears = | rank = [[General (United Kingdom)| General]] | unit = | commands = [[Royal Marines]] | battles =[[Crimean War]]
[[Second Opium War]] | awards = [[Knight Commander of the Order of the Bath]] | relations = | laterwork = }} [[General (United Kingdom)|General]] '''Sir George Augustus Schomberg''' {{post-nominals|country=GBR|size=100%|sep=,|KCB}} (5 October 1821 – 5 December 1907) was a [[Royal Marines]] officer who served as [[Commandant General Royal Marines|Deputy Adjutant-General Royal Marines]]. ==Military career== Born the son of Admiral [[Alexander Wilmot Schomberg]], Schomberg was commissioned into the [[History of the Royal Marines|Royal Marine Artillery]]. He served in the [[Baltic Sea]] during the [[Crimean War]] and then commanded the Royal Marine Artillery in [[China]] during the [[Second Opium War]].{{cite web|url=http://www.ebooksread.com/authors-eng/arthur-charles-fox-davies/armorial-families--a-directory-of-gentlemen-of-coat-armour-hci/page-282-armorial-families--a-directory-of-gentlemen-of-coat-armour-hci.shtml|title=Armourial families: a directory of coat-armour|first=Arthur Charles|last=Fox-Davies|page=282|accessdate=23 May 2016}} He became colonel commandant of the Royal Marine Artillery on 10 April 1867{{LondonGazette|issue=23242|supp=|startpage=2313|date=16 April 1867|accessdate=20 May 2016}} and then went on to be [[Commandant General Royal Marines|Deputy Adjutant-General Royal Marines]] (the professional head of the Royal Marines) in July 1872{{LondonGazette|issue=23875|supp=|startpage=3146|date=12 July 1872|accessdate=20 May 2016}} before retiring in August 1875.{{LondonGazette|issue=24234|supp=|startpage=3913|date=6 August 1875|accessdate=20 May 2016}} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} {{s-start}} {{s-mil}} {{s-bef|before=[[Samuel Lowder|Sir Samuel Lowder]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Commandant General Royal Marines|Deputy Adjutant-General Royal Marines]]|years=1872–1875}} {{s-aft|after=[[George Brydges Rodney (Royal Marines officer)|George Rodney]]}} {{s-end}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Schomberg, George}} [[Category:1821 births]] [[Category:1907 deaths]] [[Category:Royal Marines generals]] [[Category:Knights Commander of the Order of the Bath]] [[Category:British military personnel of the Crimean War]] [[Category:British military personnel of the Second Opium War]]
